item.title: Report E-2025030455
item.description:
Report E-2025030455

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one hundred (100) pounds of material released from two (2) 50-pound plastic bags due to a puncture that resulted from a forklift accident. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight containerized the released material into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. A third 5-gallon poly drum containerized the damaged plastic bags. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030436
item.description:
Report E-2025030436

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The material shipped as 41/ 55-gallon drums of paint related material for solvent recovery. When the material arrived, it was determined that 42 drums of paint related material was received instead of 41. Reclaimed Energy did an incident investigation and it was determined that 42 drums were picked up from the customer on 3/12/2025 and not 41 drums. The material was managed as a hazardous waste. Reclaimed Energy managed the waste in an appropriate manner. The generator has been notified.

item.title: Report E-2025030459
item.description:
Report E-2025030459

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: TERRE HAUTE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 18000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an area measuring approximately 3ft-by-3ft of the trailer floor and a 4ft-by4ft area of concrete parking lot and estimated that fifteen (15) gallons of material was released due to a defective weld seam on one (1) 350-gallon metal tote. First Call Environmental personnel deployed absorbent boom to prevent migration of the released material and then used granular absorbents to gather the released material. The spent absorbents were recovered and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
